message.content:
cs.LG, cs.CV, cs.HC, cs.SD, cs.NE

The paper describes a deep learning approach to predict ground reaction forces and moments from wearable sensor accelerations in sports. This involves the use of convolutional neural networks (CNNs) and supervised learning techniques. Therefore, the most likely arXiv CS sub-category is cs.LG (Machine Learning). The paper also involves computer vision techniques for analyzing motion data, which suggests a possible fit with cs.CV (Computer Vision). Additionally, the paper has implications for human-computer interaction and ergonomics, which could place it in the cs.HC (Human-Computer Interaction) sub-category. The paper also involves simulation and modeling of motion data, which could fit with cs.SD (Software Engineering). Finally, the paper has implications for sports science and injury prevention, which could place it in the cs.NE (Neural and Evolutionary Computing) sub-category.
